intro: Adenandra bodkinii, commonly known as the Cape chestnut, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and alternate, elliptical leaves. The plant produces yellow, urn-shaped flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release winged seeds. Adenandra bodkinii is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
